website_summaries.verdict: While it may be a bit overpriced, the Momentum 2.0 Wireless is an excellent and well-designed Bluetooth headphone with active noise-cancellation that also offers strong wired performance.
pros: The Sennheiser Momentum 2.0 Wireless is a well-designed, sturdy headphone, that folds up for more compact storage and features excellent sound over Bluetooth, as well as over a wired connection
The headphone is also equipped with active noise-cancellation and has dual microphones for use as a cell-phone headset
cons: like the Beats Studio Wireless, you can't turn noise-cancellation off (it's always on when you use Bluetooth)

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart in less than 5 months
customer_reviews.text: These WERE great while they worked, but the build quality is horrific. Don't buy these; They may as well be $50 headphones. I will asking for a refund/RMA or filing an insurance claim.
customer_reviews.author: Adam C.

customer_reviews.title: An ode to my recently departed headsets
customer_reviews.text: These were far and away the best headsets I've ever owned. They let through some noise but I've yet to discover something nearly as pleasing for flights. I bought them back in 2016 when they were roughly $440 and haven't lived to regret it until I rushed out on a work trip and left them behind in a hotel. The lows are fantastic on these, listening to audiophile quality tunes you could actually tell a marked difference over others. I might take awhile to buy another pair given the price tag but they were truly phenomenal.
customer_reviews.author: Franco Caliz-aguilar

customer_reviews.title: Great mid-tones, noise cancellation is sufficient
customer_reviews.text: I work in a relatively loud office and the noise cancelling is sufficient but not fully cancelling. The sound quality is amazing however and the battery lasts quite a while. They are also super comfortable and pair quickly and reliably with my computer and phone. If mid-tone sound quality (with decent bass) is important then these are great. If you are looking for fully noise cancelling they may not be the right fit. But, again, the noise cancellation is sufficient to block out most office background noise.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: I'm impressed
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, amazing battery life, sound quality is superb. I listen to metal music primarily, so this can be hit and miss with headphones - the momentum's deliver excellent sound quality, though, with special attention being paid to the mids and highs. Low end is fine - but won't compare to Beats or something that is targeting heavy bass delivery. These headphones are going to be ideal for dense music with intricate instrumentation, bringing out the sounds of each instrument fairly.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, sounds good.
customer_reviews.text: I have fallen in love with their looks. Sound is little better with wire so Bluetooth can be better implemented. Also no app support so you can't change sound profile, also there is no update since last 2 years to its firmware. Volume up & down works but skipping tracks doesn't work after 1 year so button quality is not that good. Also there is no auto off feature, so if you forgot to turn it off, it is very possible next time you will be out of juice. Following things can be improved: a) Provide app ( for equalization & updates) b) auto turn off battery. c) Better button quality for skipping tracks.
customer_reviews.author: palash h.

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned Sennheiser headphones for my TV for years (hearing disability) and had been very satisfied with quality and longevity, so I ordered these with confidence in Sennheiser quality. Boy, was I disappointed. The first pair had constant static. I sent them back. The second pair had a constant interruption in the signal. I sent those back and bought a cheaper brand. Much better. Even when the Sennheisers worked, the sound quality was disappointing although I must say the noise cancelling was superior. I would not recommend unless the seller had a good return policy (which Amazon does).
customer_reviews.author: kingofthejungle

customer_reviews.title: sennheiser fan boy
customer_reviews.text: i hate to leave sennheiser anything less than a great review but.... ANC - active noise cancelling ----- CAN NOT BE TURNED OFF FOR BLUETOOTH!!!!! my PXC-550's had a switch to turn off.... ANC sounds like you can't pop your ears when taking off in an airplane. they sounded fine, but really lay on the noise cancelling effect when listening to ambient / classical music. unacceptable! the next momentiums better have the option to disable ANC!!!!
customer_reviews.author: drew drew

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound quality both Bluetooth and esp. wired...
customer_reviews.text: One of the best headphones I’ve ever owned. Sound quality is great via Bluetooth...even better wired (which I normally do). Very comfortable. Maybe they don’t look as nice as others...but who cares...the sound quality is far above Beats or any other popular name brand. I use a mini amp FiiO Q5 that amplifies the sound from my devices. I also use, EQu equalizer IOS app. Both of these drastically improves the sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Gutschow

customer_reviews.title: You get great sound and quality construction
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are everything that Sennheiser is famous for. From the genuine leather ear cups to the quality construction, these are worth every penny. They sound absolutely fantastic. The speakers pick up those sounds that you would never ever hear on lesser headphones. The noise cancellation does what it's supposed to do. It removes droning noise. You will hear a baby cry or a dog bark. Buy these if you appreciate quality.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Sarfati

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound and comfort.
customer_reviews.text: First of all, these headphones sound like good Sennheiser. The sound is clear, dynamic, is involving and very natural. No bass added, no highs elevated. They are comfortable to wear, are made well and look great. Control is simple and easy to memorize. Sound isolation is good for me, I don’t want more of it. There are few quirks though that might bother you. Sitting in a bus on a bumpy road I hear rather unpleasant clicks on almost every bump. Tried to fix that by fitting the headphones in different ways with no avail. But I don’t travel in buses too often, so that is not a major issue for me. Other than that the headphones are pure pleasure.
customer_reviews.author: Aram

customer_reviews.title: Excellent with one irritating issue
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic headphone. The audio quality is exceptional. The noise cancelling is enhanced by the tight seal you get around your ears. The battery life is very good, the build quality is excellent. The issue, for some reason if you're commuting with these headphones on, you hear the clinking of the metal in the bands. Sometimes it will also transfer all the vibrations around you like a closing door will come thru as a dull thump. It doesn't happen all the time but when it does it's really irritating. I wish it wasn't like that since the rest of the headphone is exceptional.
customer_reviews.author: NavH

customer_reviews.title: Noise distortion on high pitched piano chords or high pitched strings
customer_reviews.text: I listen to a lot of classical piano music at moderate levels from my iPhone , from Satie to Boulez, and this pair of headphones distort resonant high pitched chords when they were played fortissimo by the pianist. I have tested this with two different sets of the Momentum 2 wireless Headphones, which I returned. This distortion never occurred when listening to the same piano pieces thru my Bose QC35 (bluetooth) nor thru my Sennheiser HD1 (wired) nor thru my Beyer and Dynamic (wired).
customer_reviews.author: Daido Klein

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: I bought my son a wired set of these as a Christmas present a year or two ago. I put them on a couple months ago and was impressed at how good the sounded. I mentioned it to him and he surprised me with these wireless ones this Christmas. They sound great! I travel for work a lot and they are perfect for flying. Comfortable and fairly light weight. Metal frame so they are sturdy. I would definitely recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: vicky regis

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones so so much! I love that they're wireless, but can also be wired for charging and you can STILL use them while charging. I've encountered headphones where if they're plugged in for charging; forget it- can't use'em. They're also super comfortable, great sound, battery life is excellent. I've had these for about 6 months now and use them primarily at my desk job- 0 complaints. If you're primary concern is noise cancellation, i think Bose are better in that aspect, but these aren't bad by any means in noise cancellation- just not the best. Love the build quality, sound, and features!
customer_reviews.author: Cap'n Oats

customer_reviews.title: No heavy bass, doesn’t reach high volumes
customer_reviews.text: Bought these after looking for high-quality bass headphones... I own a pair of MDX Sony bass boosting and they are no joke 2x the loudness and 2x the bass quality. I was looking for an upgrade but this surely isn’t it. Not sure I would pay $100 for these, as the Sony’s are $150 give or take $20 depending on the day. Disappointed because other reviews spoke so highly.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I don't want to sound whiny, but I was expecting better sound quality, than what these headphones provide. While I am by no means an audiophile, I do know the difference between crisp sound and muddy, and these are more the latter. I guess I chalk it up to, "You get what you pay for." 8 months later: Sound had become so choppy, and cuts out so bad I can't use them. Contacted Sennheiser, for help and am still waiting. I did get a ticket number though, and than is a "comfort." I will not ever buy a Sennheiser product again.
customer_reviews.author: Ravenspeaks

customer_reviews.title: Best Bet in the Poker Room
customer_reviews.text: Tried a bunch of high end cans, including the Audeze wired, for use in poker rooms with an i7+. Audeze has superlative audio response but is wired which precludes charging at the same time. The Sennheisers are just a tiny notch below Audeze in overall flat response and presence - not too much noise cancelling so youʻre still aware of your environment. Small form factor, very comfortable for long tern use. Both Audeze and Sennheisers are winning hands over Bose QC35.
customer_reviews.author: The Skyman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and well made wireless headphones
customer_reviews.text: I already owned a pair of wired Sennheiser heaphones I have used for years and really liked them. These wireless ones have bigger ear covers and excellent outside noise elimination. They sound amazing and stay put on my head during workouts at the gym where I use them. They are made out of high quality materials like leather and metal. They may be a bit heavier than current headphones I see in the gym but there is no plastic on these “Ferrari’s.” Battery life is also very good and they pair with my iPhone immediately. Love them so far!!
customer_reviews.author: RJT69

customer_reviews.title: Even better than the reviews!
customer_reviews.text: These Sennheiser headphones are truly audiophile quality sound right out of the box. Don't waste time with them on services like iHeart, as they will quickly demonstrate the low fidelity of the feed. Used with Amazon Music or Pandora, the vibrancy, frequency responsiveness and crisp sound quality are just as Audiophile describes! With eyes wide shut and a classic John Coltrane track playing, the sound imagery is amazing! Can't wait to set these up with my HK integrated amp, because everytime I challenge this headset with another HiFi performance bar, they meet it head on!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: great sound, no noise
customer_reviews.text: My son bought these. He has another set of Sennheiser headphones but he wanted Bluetooth. So, now he has both. These collapse for easy storage in the provided bag. They are lightweight and have a Great sound quality. The noise cancellation works well enough that I now have to tap his shoulder to get his attention. The battery life is good though I'm not sure how good - only that he wears them all day and doesn't charge them til he goes to bed. In addition, these have a cord that can be plugged in so that they can be directly hooked into the computer or another device if you don't want to use the bluetooth mode.
customer_reviews.author: strazydaze

customer_reviews.title: Mostly excellent, just not for me
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love these headphones. They look and feel premium. Unfortunately with the pressure on my ears I couldn't keep them on for more than 20 minutes. I do have a large head and larger ears to match... so there isn't a lot of room for my ears inside these cups. Perhaps that's part of it. But there is a bit of an uncomfortable pressure when using them in wireless mode from the ANC that isn't present in wired mode. Sadly my quest for wireless headphones is not over yet. It's hard to compete with HD 598 open backs. I may just have to stick with wired.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Great sturdy headphones
customer_reviews.text: The battery lasts forever. The headphones have a british voice no matter what and i really love hearing it. The volume control is smooth and easy to use. The cups completely cover my ears and are very comfortable. The band is covered in the leather and is also very comfortable. Unlike some headphones I've owned before, the band and hinges are full metal making it way more durable, thank goodness. The noise cancelling cant be turned off but it's very strong and doesnt sacrifice sound quality for it.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan H

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable, and poor noise-cancellation
customer_reviews.text: I can't wear these for more than an hour without constantly trying to re-adjust. The part that rests on the top of your head has very little padding, and gets super uncomfortable for me. The noise cancellation really isn't very good. You can tell it's doing something, but don't buy these expecting to block out people at the office. Battery life is great. Design is really good (the reason I bought them over Bose). Speakers are cushy and comfy. Folds for travel/packing.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna Fanduzzi

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones, wish there was software.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Well made, sounds good, great battery life. My only issue with these, having worn them for months now, is the fact that there is no app for an eq, and there is no passthrough mode. From what I understand, they discontinued support app support for these headphones, I don’t know why. Using the aux cabe with the headphones powered off, there is only passive noise cancelation, powering them on enables active noise cancelation, so that is all the control you have over noise cancelation. Opt for the 3rd gen if you have the extra $100 or so, but these are the best and most expensive over ear headphones I have owned, so that is where my experience ends.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Pew

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound quality with some bugs
customer_reviews.text: Initially Loved the headphones, great sound quality with an incredibly intuitive and comfortable design. Unfortunately, for some reason the "bluetooth" functionality sometimes stops working and I have to resort to plugging in the headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Salman Jilani

customer_reviews.title: Very good for the price and form factor. Decent sound and beautifully made.
customer_reviews.text: Fit and finish is first-rate, luxurious even, but I'm more impressed with the sound quality via Bluetooth. They are virtually indistinguishable from the wired version, which I used to own. You pay a penalty for the form factor with either - they do not sound like audiophile models from Sennheiser, Grado, Beyerdynamic etc., but I doubt you'll find better in the compact wireless arena. Bose and Sony are not quite there, and the enormously overrated Beats don't come close. A warm but detailed sound overall, though I find the midrange is subdued.
customer_reviews.author: Holdenitdown

customer_reviews.title: Nice feel, clear bass
customer_reviews.text: Nice feel, clear bass, nice BT implementation with Mac. Bought these to replace a 1 year old set of Beats Studio cans. Far better audio and BT implementation. I no longer need to power cycle my headphones to reconnect with my mac after going to sleep (going to a meeting and returning to my desk). Like the feel, more studio like, a bit less heavy and honestly, I've been a fan of Senns' for every. Keeping up with the bluetooth tech has paid off for these. Would not only by again, but would recommend. I'd give the 5th star if they automatically connected to my mac after coming out sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Bill R.

customer_reviews.title: Sound is great. Love the APT-x
customer_reviews.text: Sound is great. Love the APT-x! Noise cancelling is good enough (sometimes I just use them instead of ear-plugs while flying). 2 nits - when you plug the USB cable (like, for charging), the Bluetooth gets disconnected. A bit annoying. - the right one does not hold very strong to the metal rail and moves, so I have to adjust it more often than I'd like
customer_reviews.author: A. Bonev

customer_reviews.title: best sound quality in this price range for wireless headphones
customer_reviews.text: they beat most competition by far, throw out your apple pods, beats etc....out the window yes, the noise cancellation isn't the best, but it works. however the sound quality beats all of them the bass is very good, not over steered, very clear and deep. the mids and highs are great. you will hear sounds you have not heard with lower class headphones. i listen mostly to electronic music.
customer_reviews.author: Lukas

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound! Great retro but modern look and feel! Exactly what you would expect from Sennheiser!
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones more than any wireless headphones that I have used. The sound quality on these headphones is nothing short of amazing, the base is solid but not over done. I can hook to my ipad or iphone without having to do anything at all once paired. I leave ipad on my desk and go anywhere inside or outside my home which is crazy! 2 Month update: These are my favorite headphones of all time!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My Ears 👂 are Very Warm Now
customer_reviews.text: I bought these fancy ear 👂 muffs to keep my ears 👂 warm. The only problem is that they are very noisy ear muffs. My ears are warm now but rattled by the constant blathering of music. It’s like a tv 📺 is strapped to your head. I you are looking for ear warmers like me, you should also purchase these ear warmers like I did. Just remove the wires and you’ll be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Great set of headphones
customer_reviews.text: It's a quality set of headphones, I picked it's design for the simplicity and I don't think these will break apart like most plastic units, especially where the phones meat the headband. One feature I wish this had was some audio or visual indicator of how low the battery level is, that said I've had 16 hour sessions with these on and the battery wasn't drained yet.
customer_reviews.author: Roy G.

customer_reviews.title: Like them better then the bose
customer_reviews.text: I have both the Bose and Sennheiser. I picked up the Sennheiser when amazon had a sale and the price was right. The noise cancellation is better on the Bose, but the sound quality of the Sennheiser more then makes up for some outside noise making it through. I had to charge the Bose once every 3 days of use, but the Sennheiser I charge once a week just out so they don't die on the 2nd week of use.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew S. Moore

customer_reviews.title: I legitimately use these every day and love the sound quality and noise cancelling ability
customer_reviews.text: I legitimately use these every day and love the sound quality and noise cancelling ability. Fantastic, comfortable, with a great range of sound. Good mids and highs, less power in the base region compared to other headphones of a similar quality, but I would much rather hear a song clearly than be bass blasted.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Graff

customer_reviews.title: Defective item? Hope so.
customer_reviews.text: We have enjoyed Sennheiser wireless headphones for years and decided to upgrade to this more Tec advanced new model. This pair failed on multiple dimensions, Noise cancellation did not work at all. Would not work with iPod. Did not provide true high fidelity sound in comparison with our old headphones. Sound volume not controllable between input sources (e.g. going from one channel of Prime Music to another or switching from streaming TV to music). All in a great disappointment. Returned for credit.
customer_reviews.author: Word Maven

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth connectivity issues.
customer_reviews.text: Got the old headphones that had bluetooth problem connecting with my MacBook pro. When connected to iPhone 7 sound was really nice and punchy in the base department. The headphones were a little uncomfortable for me as the tips of my ears were touching the plastic inside the ear cups. Noise cancellation was okay, but wasn't perfect isolation. Going to return them and try the Sennheiser pxc 550. Hopefully I'll have a more positive experience. I really liked the look of the Momentum, what a shame.
customer_reviews.author: John L

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: This pair of headphones has no glaring defects, but overall provides a meh experience. Sound quality is decent overall, and the headphones are very light. The size adjustment feels like it keeps slipping a bit. For my money though, I would choose the Bowers and WIlkins active noise cancelling headphones.
customer_reviews.author: CL

customer_reviews.title: Very good performance
customer_reviews.text: I have been trying to order sennheiser momentum wireless everywhere since September, finally get them here, sennheiheiser's official website is always out of stock, and they ship it in a slow way so I suggest you buy it from Amazon, by far it performs very well, I didn't see any problem in Bluetooth connection, it works for about the range of 15m( not sure), and the battery last very long,great sound performance. The only small problem is that when you try to use wire to listen instead of the Bluetooth, you have to switch Bluetooth on first and then turn it off, or else the sound only comes out from one ear
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Incredible headphones
customer_reviews.text: I have this headphones for like 4 years, they are just great. Premium materials (except for the ear cups), and really nice sound. Really strong bluetooth connection.I use them in subway and buses, really noisy environments, with no trouble. They will not isolate completely from outside, but the noise cancelling don't harm your ears.
customer_reviews.author: Martin C.

customer_reviews.title: So glad I bought these!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not an audiophile, but travel quite a bit, and the Bose Acoustimass headphones I have make my ears too hot. After reading all of the reviews for the Sennheiser, Bose, Sony and Beats products, I chose these. I'm definitely glad that I did! The sound quality is great, noise cancellation works wonders, and they are very comfortable. I'm totally happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: E. Ueno

customer_reviews.title: Stellar sound
customer_reviews.text: Pricey, but definitely the best headphones I've ever worn. The build oozes quality. Lush comfort on your ears—even with glasses. Battery lasts for days. ... Oh, and sounds like your in a soundproofed recording studio with the band as they record the song. Bluetooth phonecalls can be a bit spotty on the mic transmission, but you don't get these to talk on the phone.
customer_reviews.author: M. Popp

customer_reviews.title: Quality Headset just one minor problem
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is top notch and ear cup adjustment is pretty study, Although a week in, my pairs did get a little loose and wobble now. However the sliding adjustment still holds them in place. The noise cancellation isn’t incredibly strong which is nice when I have to listen out for train conductors on my commute, or just friends trying to talk tome while I listen to music. Overall nice quality headset. Just wish the ivory ones were same price.
customer_reviews.author: Rico

customer_reviews.title: Not as expected.  3 out of 5.  Expected more
customer_reviews.text: I like these but honestly expected more. Sound quality is good not very loud. When use plug on airplane sound in only one ear. Really wanted for call functions. Some calls are great other calls I have to disconnect. So not consistent. Past return as I’d exchange. Put over all good but not close to what I was expecting.
customer_reviews.author: Lamar vabch

customer_reviews.title: Where have you been all my life!?
customer_reviews.text: Oh my gawd! I can't believe how many sounds I've been missing. I've owned some middle-tier Bose Quiet Comfort headphones, and I liked them well enough, but I really didn't get what all the excitement was about. I put these on, listened to the Greatest Showman soundtrack, and was amazed at all the details I've never heard before. I don't know how these compare with other high-end headphones, but I have never experienced sound like that before.
customer_reviews.author: Radpix Ninja

customer_reviews.title: Amazing headphones! Put beats to shame
customer_reviews.text: It’s all about the bass with these! Great sound quality but it hits those low sound frequencies as well without drowning out the rest of the music. Noise cancellation isn’t overwhelming but with music on, you won’t notice outside noise
customer_reviews.author: Billy T.

customer_reviews.title: Great set of cans
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is fantastic. Very clear and nuanced. Bluetooth connectivity is easy and reliable, even with multiple sources. Noise cancellation is good but not oppressive. I tried the Bose QC35s. The Bose had unbelievable noise cancelling but it induced motion sickness in me (look it up, it's a thing). The noise cancelling on the Momentums is not as good, but more than adequate for most and did not cause any issues with motion sickness.
customer_reviews.author: Nic S

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: Headphones feel amazing on my head, solid and high quality without being too heavy. Buttons have a good tactile feel. Controls are minimal and can be easily accessed by touch. Sound quality is what you'd expect from a $200 pair of Sennheisers, it sounds great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Sound
customer_reviews.text: Very clear and well balanced sound, I have now had these for a few months. Sound is still fantastic, I have no problem. I would like to add that I bought them to replace a set of JBL 50 that I bought a few weeks before. The JBL sounded good in the store and work if wired but the Bluetooth is disgustingly distorted. I found the same problem with a JBL sound bar. Believe me if you love music don't even think of anything else but these sennheiser phones. My wife has Bose which are very good but these are better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: First day impression from a novice headphone person.
customer_reviews.text: Normal person review - bought these because of the great deal (@ $250). First day impression... music comes out in both ears in a pleasing way, fit is very comfortable for a person with glasses and a hat, but a bit bulkier than I thought from photos. I would not wear these outside my house for fear of metal detectors and questions about the audio quality because they are sure to draw attention. Blu canine connection was very easy. Was recommended the brand and very happy with the last minute change of heart.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for air travel.
customer_reviews.text: Used on a recent trip. Noise cancellation is excellent for air travel, even without anything playing on them. I just turned them on for a nap at one point. I haven't tried them with the lawn mower yet, but I'm not expecting them to be as good as earplugs as that is not their intended design. Battery life is incredible. Easily connected every time. Controls take some time to figure out with the multifunction button, but is easy to locate with either hand. Phone calls are clear with absolutely no issues with the other party hearing me. Well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas U'Ren

customer_reviews.title: Everything about the M2 is terrific expect for the fit
customer_reviews.text: Everything about the M2 is terrific expect for the fit. There is a small protrusive nob in the center of each ear piece that impinges and causes discomfort after 1-2 hours of use. Everything else is fantastic. Regret having to return this item. Could just be my ears...
customer_reviews.author: Coracoid Process

customer_reviews.title: Received as a gift. Never would have bought them on my own.
customer_reviews.text: I received these as a gift and knew they would be an expensive problem right away, but was convinced not to return them and give them a shot. They connect to my devices maybe 20% of the time, and the batteries die quickly. Mostly they are just frustrating to look at.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren S. Chalas

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, high quality build, great sound.
customer_reviews.text: Holy heck, I love the sound from these. Comfortable enough to wear all day long, and the battery lasts 22 hours of play time. I have the first gen wired momentums as well, and I loved those too, but these are far and above more comfortable. The Bluetooth connection is spotty out in the open, as to be expected, but inside they work fantastically. Why should you buy these? They work in passive mode when the battery dies. Win.
customer_reviews.author: Steve S

customer_reviews.title: Not best craftsmanship. 2 sets of headphones later.
customer_reviews.text: Great sound, OK noise canceling. Not as good as competitors. Craftsmanship is so so. First pair had stitching that came out after a month. Second pair had a battery that fell loose inside and rattled with every head movement. Look super cool wearing them, heck yes! Worth the high price? Probably not.
customer_reviews.author: Kacey T

customer_reviews.title: Excellent headphones at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: First time in a long time that I've purchased "full-sized" headphones and, I've also long been skeptical of the noise-canceling function. These headphones won me over on both counts. The larger size provides both excellent sound quality and awesome noise cancelation. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Townsends

customer_reviews.title: I purchased these headsets two years ago...
customer_reviews.text: I use them EVERY day. They are amazing. Their performance... amazing. One of the headphone slider started slipping about a year ago. I didn't mind. A week ago... when you put them on, left side dripped down ear like ice cream cone on perfect summer day. Sent them back. Super eager to get my old cans back. Nope. Sennheiser sent upgrade. You guys Rock!!! Sennheiser cust svc? One word... Outstanding. :] Danke shane.
customer_reviews.author: javier

customer_reviews.title: nice
customer_reviews.text: as expected. the distance range is crazy good. they are very comfy, does not give ear fatigue. batterly life is top notch. I am bald, and the comfort on my head is good. the earphones are not heavy. the weight is in the top of the band on the head. noice.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin B. Stone

customer_reviews.title: Sound Great on my iPhone XR
customer_reviews.text: Very picky about my audio, KEF's for home audio system, and needed wireless headphones for my iPhone when I travel and in the office. Audio quality is excellent for the price point, yes you do hear some airplane background noise and some conversations but they are muffled, and yes those with sharper hearing will from time to time hear conversations of loud talkers. Overall you really only hear the music or whatever you are listening too. Battery life is excellent, used for over 10 hours and did not run out of power. FYI, security camera's, mainly airports, will from time to time interfere with the bluetooth signal, you will notice as you walk by them.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Pretty great Headphones, worth it
customer_reviews.text: I have had some bad luck with wireless headphones. Since I wear glasses I normally can't wear over the hear for too long or it'll start hurting. These have plenty of cushion to help with that. I work 8 hours in an office and wear these all day. The sound is great and the noise cancelation is fantastic. I would buy another pair if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Betsy

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, comfortable, good battery life!
customer_reviews.text: Fell in love with them straight out of the box. The noise cancelling is considerably more neutral than the Bose equivalent - it doesn't feel heavy and dead just quiet. Reproduction quality is great and the dual Bluetooth connectivity makes it easy to work with my PC and tablet without lots of switching of Bluetooth connections.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly What I Was Hoping For - Excellence
customer_reviews.text: These sound wonderful. And they're comfortable. The price is not longer $500 but $200 and what's not to like about that?! The Bluetooth pairing to my iPhone was immediate and super easy. I think I'm going to have these for a long while.
customer_reviews.author: JoeyLeePM

customer_reviews.title: Love them! If you're torn between these or the ...
customer_reviews.text: Love them! If you're torn between these or the $100 cheaper DefTech Stpymphony 1's, please spend the extra $100 and buy these.. The difference in sound alone is huge, these make music come to life whereas the Symphony 1's sound dull and lifeless with too much low end emphasis which kills the mids and highs. Also, the sweet spot for these seems to be with your ears as far forward in the cup as you can vs the middle or back which brings out the mids and highs while allowing the lows to resonate behind your ear.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon T

customer_reviews.title: Not owning these - at ANY price, would be a lifetime mistake.
customer_reviews.text: I've never gone out of my way to write a product review before. The first time I wore HD-1's, I looked at the owner within seconds and asked 'what do these cost?' because I knew that I needed to have a pair. These are that product at half the price. Simply stated, these are as close to perfect headphones as I've found in decades. Audio Quality, Noise Cancellation, Comfort for wear are all best in class. Literally the best I've experienced. If you came far enough to read this review, you're interested in good headphones. Not having these in your life would be an absolute mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Darias

customer_reviews.title: Great bassy low budget audiophile type headphones
customer_reviews.text: Great sound quality! Just the right amount of heavy bass to match the highs and mids. They are very comfortable and shape perfectly around my ears, except I will sometimes find my ears touching the inside of the headphones and for people with wider ears that stick out more I could see how it might bother them. Pretty good noise cancelation. Just enought to block out the noisy highway I live 40 yards away from and my noisy a/c when it kicks on, even though that's not even why I got it, but if you are looking for really good bass that matches the rest of the sound quality then these are very worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I love the look and style of these, but I'm starting to realize I should have looked at the lower star reviews before purchasing them! The quality is definitely not up to par with the price you are paying. ALSO, after two months of buying these, the right side stopped working. Luckily there is a 2-year warranty with the company and after two weeks when I sent them back in, I received a brand new pair from them. I probably would advise against this product. Seems like they didn't put the quality into their product that you are paying for.
customer_reviews.author: Jess E

customer_reviews.title: Good noise cancellation and great battery life
customer_reviews.text: These are great for walking my dog or traveling. With earbuds, I used to have to turn the volume all of the way up to hear. I’m able to reduce the volume by half with these and protect my future hearing. The only time I’ve had to recharge these headphones are after using them as a headset for a 2 hour phone conversation. I had already used them for HOURS as headphones before the phone call.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany

customer_reviews.title: the sound was fantastic and the noise cancelling was like magic but after ...
customer_reviews.text: the sound was fantastic and the noise cancelling was like magic but after using them for 45 min the blue tooth connection would drop in and out. I hiked with them and after 20 min they were unusable with the constant signal drops and no sound. If the blutooth was better like the Beats I'd have kept these and fought anyone .. but the drops killed me so I returned them.
customer_reviews.author: Derek R.

customer_reviews.title: Great Sounding Headphones though a little hot
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones. They pair easily with my phone, computer and iPod. The sound is really good and the noise cancellation works fine. My only complaint is that the enclosed ear cup trimmed with leather makes me warm.
customer_reviews.author: Amazing Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well but no bass.
customer_reviews.text: Either I received an already "blown" pair of "new" cans or the bass in these are terrible. They work well, sound clear, but really have no bass to it. They sound light and airy. (Cranking bass in equilizer just results in bad distortion.) This is my first wireless pair of headphones, so maybe wireless tech can't push bass or something, but for the price, the audio quality is pretty low. I end up using my 5 year old wired headphones just because they sound much better.
customer_reviews.author: Z~

customer_reviews.title: My favorite headphones
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite headphones. Sound quality is good, they do a good job of attenuating background noise, last a long time on a charge, and I don't have to worry about getting cords stuck on things. I'm very happy with the sound quality and the sense of quite isolation it gives me. I wear them when I'm trying to concentrate on reading or writing at work, and on plane flights, they're great. Plus, I like the way that they look.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy P. Meyers

customer_reviews.title: Great for music, no side tone for phone calls
customer_reviews.text: An earlier review stated that these are not so great for phone calls and I agree. Since this is my first pair of ANC cans I have no basis for comparison but the noise cancelling works well in flight and in an open office environment. It's been my experience with iPhones that it's easy to max out headphone volume, but they will play slightly louder through the wired connection. For phone calls I'll just stick to the standard ear pods.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Best In town by far.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are the best around. Unfortunately I had to cancel my order so I could buy a different model number but exactly the same performance. The person I bought them for was too particular. I personally have this model and in this price range you will not find a better set of cans. I tried the Sony 1000 ( the new model ) and the new Bose and these are definitely the best by a long shot.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Excellent over the ears headphones
customer_reviews.text: I have tried several over the ear headphones and these are by far the most comfortable. I used them during long flights without feeling that my ears on fire. The noice cancellation is very good and on bluetooth you can use the controls on the headphones like volume and skip sounds but not with the cable.
customer_reviews.author: ALESSANDRA HERNANDEZ

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Ear cups are way too small. An $80 pair of Phillips headphones should not be blowing these out of the water in terms of comfort. Sounds fine and the Bluetooth works great, but neither matter since these start to make my ears hurt after 15 minutes or so.
customer_reviews.author: Julian

customer_reviews.title: These are SO good.
customer_reviews.text: When I first put them on my ears, I was amazed. Have gotten used to it by now, but definitely the best headphones or earphones I've ever gotten (and I had a lot, most recently the highly rated V-Moda)
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Trash
customer_reviews.text: Noise cancellation is very painful and can not be turned off. Absolute waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: briskmojo

customer_reviews.title: Worth It
customer_reviews.text: Simply amazing headphones. I've had these for several months now, and they still feel practically new. Comfortable, great sound, premium feel, long battery life, great isolation, and great noise cancellation. I like the cable lock mechanism, but I do wish the cable itself were better. However, that's getting pretty picky imo.
customer_reviews.author: Jess Lira

customer_reviews.title: Sleek and modern
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing!! Definitely worth the higher price tag. Love the sleek modern look and easy fit. Comfortable to wear for long trips. Easy to pair with bluetooth. I get a lot of compliments on them. Great sound!!
customer_reviews.author: Julie B

customer_reviews.title: Good headset, battery can use improvement.
customer_reviews.text: The headset is good, range for bluebooth is good and the sound clarity is great while you have battery life, once battery starts to die, sound begins to get distorted. Packaging was good, came with a pouch and case for the headset as well as an audio plug for those who like to keep their headsets plugged in. Bluetooth wise, battery lasts, but can use a bit of improvement. Still overall a good product.
customer_reviews.author: dmitriy

customer_reviews.title: Can I return it?
customer_reviews.text: Connected it to my PC via Bluetooth. It won't play background music, while also playing the sound from my game. Expensive headset for limited functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy and Martine

customer_reviews.title: SENNHEISER NEVER DOES A POOR JOB AND KEEPS IMPROVING
customer_reviews.text: WOW all i can say is well done Sennheiser made a product that is designed superb for the city commuter, a pair of headphones that 1. last over 20 hours and 2. have a descent sound quality for Bluetooth. my only niche is that the signal gets lost many times because millions of people in the city are using the same Bluetooth connection
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: Sound profile is quite good, actually a bit better than my Bose QC 35s. Bose noise cancellation is better, and I think the Bose battery life is better. All in all, a very good set of headphones. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Fritz kuhlman

customer_reviews.title: Decent price, very nice set of headphones.
customer_reviews.text: I was very eager to try these out after doing a few weeks of research. The sound quality is very good. The bass has a nice round depth to it that I was pleasantly surprised to hear and experience. There is definitely a noise cancellation presence but it is not absolute; which works fine for me so I can listen out for my children. I would definitely recommend these to anyone seriously searching for a better set of headphones. For the price, I am very satisfied with what I received. I am wearing them now and couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Monroe

customer_reviews.title: Stunning. I don't know why they are so inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: These are bargain Audiophile headphones. Tight bass, delicate mids and highs. You can hear the room and soundstage. Mozart Requiem is stunning. And try Opeth live at Red Rocks Ampitheater, drums and bass so tight, great vocals. You don't need to eq these.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Scott

customer_reviews.title: So nice I bought two sets.
customer_reviews.text: Bought two so I had a set at home and at work. People are amazed at the noise cancellation at work. I use them mostly to listen to edm. Great sound quality. Well made and cool looking.
customer_reviews.author: DougM

customer_reviews.title: Order these with a bottle of resolene!
customer_reviews.text: Everything about these headphones makes me want tp give them 5 stars; style=amazing, sound quality=great, active noise canceling=great, U/I=intuitive. The reason that these get a 3 star rating is because of expected quality for price paid. Apparently Sennheiser doesn't know that dyed leather needs to be sealed. These headphones have ruined a few shirts of mine due to the dye of the leather leaching onto them.
customer_reviews.author: Wap

customer_reviews.title: Great for wearing all day.
customer_reviews.text: I use these 8 hours a day a work. I bought these after my second pair of $100 headphones broke. They are super lightweight, easy to adjust. The ear pads a a little small but if I adjust them each time I put them on the fit is fine. The noise cancellation is wonderful. I never noticed how loud the ac units were until I took these off. It blocks most sounds without being a distraction, but I have noticed I can hear people talking but I work where talking is not allowed so it stands out anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Any movement of the left ear cuff resulted in extremely loud feedback, this would range from sliding the left cuff off to talk to someone, all the way to just turning my head to the left like \. Really wanted to like them, enjoyed the aesthetic and the aux cable that would lock into the cuff.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: low quality, low sound volume
customer_reviews.text: 1) The plugin connection is loose, loss sound from time to time, you must handheld it in place. 2) Volume is too low even at max., when you listen to "Ode to Joy" you get nothing of its beginning due to low volume output. It may be good for pop. definitely not for classic.
customer_reviews.author: Yuming

customer_reviews.title: OUCH!
customer_reviews.text: Received these headphones today and they sound amazing but if I touch the sides to adjust the fit they put off a loud screeching sound right in my ears. It has been an hour since the last time it happened and my ears are still ringing. Ouch! Super disappointed. Especially since these are not cheap. Hopefully the replacements don't do the same.
customer_reviews.author: alex

customer_reviews.title: Really Good Sound Quality
customer_reviews.text: I wanted an Over the Ear headphone that pumped out the volume and my Sennheiser Momentum 2.0 do the job very well. My focus was on watching movies and the such, not listening to Hip Hop or Rap. I had a pair of Bose QC35's and they were too quiet. The Sennheiser's work really well. When researching for the loudest earphones, the Sennheiser Momentum 2.0 were described as having some comfort issues - extended wear (like watching a movie) can cause some adjustment requirements, and it's true. It's why I gave them 4 stars instead of 5. The sound quality is excellent. It's just you have to readjust them from time to time.
customer_reviews.author: tpd

customer_reviews.title: High quality, top comfort
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable on transcontinental flight. Bose noise cancelling is a bit better, these have a bit better sound. Ear holes a bit larger in these which sealed the deal.
customer_reviews.author: Keeper

customer_reviews.title: Bass quality lacks volume and depth
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product for everyday use but for music, it lacks Bass which is the most important part of music for me. The Bass can be heard but it is far from where it should be in terms of volume and depth. These are nice headphones but they do not encourage me to listen to music with them. For the same price, much better headphones can be had.
customer_reviews.author: Pierre

customer_reviews.title: Big Ears?
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is very good-almost audiophile quality. The ear cups are not for big ears. I listen for hours at a time and experience pain from this size cushion. I contacted Sennheiser and as usual there was no offer of assistance. Take it or leave it. I will continue to search for a solution. Sad because the sound is so good. Seems like Sennheiser would be interested in providing an optional product with additional fee for people like me :-)
customer_reviews.author: James Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Can’t say enough good things about these gorgeous headphones! If you need a pair of wireless headphones and don’t want to sacrifice sound, these are it.
customer_reviews.author: isaiah mack

customer_reviews.title: Sounds fantastic if you don't need the best noise cancellation or largest earcups
customer_reviews.text: Simply amazing sound quality for bluetooth headphones. Noise cancellation isn't the best, but it's still great at eliminating common room white noise like ventilation systems. Voices, not so much. Ironically sounds less lively using the wired connection, but battery life seems great and sound quality is excellent for its class. Far superior to the Beats Studio (or Solo 3's) for the money. The earcups aren't as soft as on other products though, and for an over-ear the cups are surprisingly small, so if you have huge ears you may want to try these before you buy. Very lightweight though and fairly small for a full over-ear. For the price point of an open box set these are a steal.
customer_reviews.author: InterTube Consumer

customer_reviews.title: False advertising is real on these.
customer_reviews.text: Noise cancelling doesnt work. Volume is only good at 100% turned up. At 50% you cant hear anything in volume. Very well built, super cool look and very comfortable but volume sucks and noise cancelling sucks. Only owned them for an hour and already can tell the issues. Will be returning unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Won't blue tooth connect with Samsung Galaxy S6
customer_reviews.text: Can hardly believe that after a month of use I'm having blue tooth connection issues. I bit the huge price in hopes that I would reward myself with a totally perfect set of electronics. I'm not a fan of this set not connecting with my new Samsung Galaxy S6. Spent an hour with a knowledgeable and patient tech trying to get this headset to work with my phone. They are going back and I'm back on the hunt for a headset. As far as sound quality...as awesome as the price. Huge sound and very comfortable and elegant. It's a shame. Thank you Amazon for your policies.
customer_reviews.author: SgtMaj B

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Everything about it is amazing. Everything except comfort. If I wear it for a couple hours, the strap that goes over my head becomes a pressure spot & I find myself constantly moving it forward, then backwards. I predicted that just by looking at the photos, so that's why it gets all 5 stars. It looks, sounds & functions amazingly well!
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Used on a recently flight from US to UK. Noise reduction is very good. Sound quality is very, very good. Battery Life is excellent. Comfort is very high, only after 4-5 hours of use did I start to feel uncomfortable (and almost all over-ear headphones make my ears hot and irritated after just 1-2 hours).
customer_reviews.author: DL White

product_meta.title: Sennheiser Momentum 2.0 Wireless with Active Noise Cancellation- Black
product_meta.description: Color:BlackThe new Sennheiser MOMENTUM Wireless lets you experience crystal clear MOMENTUM sound without being attached to a cable. This high resolution headset sets the benchmark for performance, style and comfort in the wireless headphone category. Bluetooth technology is integrated with engineering expertise to ensure MOMENTUM signature sound remains intact. Near Field Communication (NFC) is provided for effortless “at a touch” Bluetooth pairing with any NFC enabled device. Further enhancing the audio experience is Noise Gard hybrid active noise cancellation that virtually eliminates unwanted ambient sound. Your voice will sound crystal clear during phone calls thanks to Voice Max; dual built in microphones that dynamically cancel out external interference for perfect speech intelligibility. MOMENTUM Wireless features an iconic design using premium materials like stainless steel and real leather. New, slightly larger ear cups using ergonomically designed, memory foam cushions provide extreme comfort for long listening sessions. The stainless steel headband is now foldable for easy and compact storage in the supplied premium carry case. You can enjoy MOMENTUM Wireless everywhere!
feature_bullets: Noise Gard hybrid active noise cancellation blocks ambient noise using 4 microphones for ultimate isolation to dramatically improve sound quality in noisy environments. Connectivity Technology: Wireless
22 hour battery life with both Bluetooth and Noise Gard activated to ensure performance during long commutes or plane flights
Technology uses 2 built in microphones working seamlessly to improve voice quality and remove external noise during phone calls

Two year warranty when purchased from an authorized Sennheiser dealer. VERY IMPORTANT Please Note: Detachable cable must be inserted into headphone until it "clicks" and twisted clockwise (to the right) to lock the cable in place
Its especially low profile was optimized for the use on mobile devices.Fitted with jack plugs on both ends, the cable is completely detachable and can be replaced if necessary
Frequency Response 16 Hz to 22000 Hz , Impedance passive 28 ohm and active 480 ohm

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars1,317 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
